oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christian Brothers College Prospectus, 1871
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Educational facilities
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this, the first recruiting announcement for Christian Brothers College, Brother Maurelian detailed the costs and requirements for prospective students. Payment was invariably in advance. Tuition, board, washing, and a doctor's fee was $165.00 for five months. Students deposited $25.00 for books. No "objectionable" books could be kept, and all students were required to bring a "mosquito bar."
